events.message: The applicant submitted a request for a new auto loan to finance the purchase of a new vehicle for family use.
The loan application was categorized under Auto Loan after confirming it is intended for vehicle financing purposes.
A loan officer with expertise in auto loans was assigned to this case to assist the applicant through the process.
An initial review of the applicant's credit history and income statements was conducted to evaluate eligibility.
The applicant was asked to provide proof of income, vehicle purchase agreement, and identification documents.
All requested documents were submitted on time, including the buyer’s order and current pay slips.
A credit report was retrieved and analyzed, showing a moderate credit score with no recent defaults.
Risk assessment evaluated potential repayment risks and deemed the applicant to be a medium risk.
A loan offer outlining interest rates, repayment periods, and terms was presented to the applicant for review.
The applicant responded with acceptance of the terms and requested an expedited funding process.
Following verification and compliance checks, the loan was formally approved by the credit committee.
The approved loan amount was disbursed into the applicant’s account as per the agreed schedule.
A follow-up call was made to ensure the applicant received funds and is satisfied with the loan service.
The application case was closed successfully after confirming all conditions were met and documentation completed.
